div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1421 Cilicia, 1964 Burial: c. 320 B.C. (M) Contents: 22 AR Alexander III: 4 tetradr. (Amphipolis 2 as Demanhur 455 and 895; Tarsus 1 as D. 2428; Damascus 1 as D. 3181 var.) Athens: 15 tetradr. (as Svoronos, pl. 19, bottom-pl. 20 [3]; S., pl. 30 [12]) Imit. Athens: 3 tetradr. (as S., pl. 108, 27 [1]) Disposition: dispersed Information from H. Seyrig All coins were chisel-cut. Two additional Alexanders, not chisel-cut, which did not look like the others, were believed intrusive by Seyrig: 1 of Miletus (as Newell, Demetrius, pl. 5, 2) and 1 of Ace (as Newell 35)
